meanings.definition: (ラテン語) 押す、打つ、たたく、駆り立てる、感動させる
meanings.english_definition: (Latin) to push, strike, beat, drive, impel, move, affect

examples.note: (Literal translation: To strike the hearts of men.)

etymology.value: 印欧祖語の根 *pel-（押す、打つ）に由来する。

verb_forms.present_indicative: pulsō, pulsās, pulsat, pulsāmus, pulsātis, pulsant
verb_forms.imperfect_indicative: pulsābam, pulsābās, pulsābat, pulsābāmus, pulsābātis, pulsābant
verb_forms.future_indicative: pulsābō, pulsābis, pulsābit, pulsābimus, pulsābitis, pulsābunt
verb_forms.perfect_indicative: pulsāvī, pulsāvistī, pulsāvit, pulsāvimus, pulsāvistis, pulsāvērunt
verb_forms.pluperfect_indicative: pulsāveram, pulsāverās, pulsāverat, pulsāverāmus, pulsāverātis, pulsāverant
verb_forms.future_perfect_indicative: pulsāverō, pulsāveris, pulsāverit, pulsāverimus, pulsāveritis, pulsāverint

usage_notes.explanation: 「pulsare」はラテン語の動詞で、物理的な「押す」「打つ」という意味から、比喩的な「駆り立てる」「感動させる」という意味まで持ちます。英語の「pulse」や「impulse」などの語源となっています。

derivatives: impellere (動詞: 駆り立てる、促す)

readability_explanation.text: This is a Latin word, so readability explanations geared towards modern English may not apply.

example_sentences.translation: 運命が彼を駆り立てる。
演説者は聴衆の心を揺さぶった。
